methods.name: append
methods.summary: Appends the data from another blob to this blob.

methods.name: arrayBuffer
methods.summary: Returns a Promise that resolves with the contents of the blob as binary data contained in an ArrayBuffer.

methods.name: imageAsCompressed
methods.summary: Creates a new blob by compressing the underlying image to the specified quality.
methods.description:
Returns the compressed image as a blob.

If this blob doesn't represent an image, returns null.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.summary: Quality to compress this image to. From 0.0 (lowest quality) to 1.0 (highest quality).

methods.name: imageAsCropped
methods.summary: Creates a new blob by cropping the underlying image to the specified dimensions.
methods.description:
Returns the cropped image as a blob.

If this blob doesn't represent an image, returns null.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Image cropping options. Dimension properties are all optional for this use case.

Defaults will be to use the current image's height/width and to center the cropped rectangle horizontally/vertically on the original image (x/y).

methods.name: imageAsResized
methods.summary: Creates a new blob by resizing and scaling the underlying image to the specified dimensions.
methods.description:
Returns the resized image as a blob.

If this blob doesn't represent an image, returns null.

methods.name: imageAsThumbnail
methods.summary: Returns a thumbnail version of the underlying image, optionally with a border and rounded corners.
methods.description:
Returns the thumbnail image as a blob.

If this blob doesn't represent an image, returns null.

The final height/width of the image will actually be size + (2 * borderSize) as the border is added around the image. By default the borderSize is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.summary: Size of the thumbnail, in either width or height.

methods.name: imageWithAlpha
methods.summary: Returns a copy of the underlying image with an added alpha channel.
methods.description: Returns the new image as a blob, or null if this blob is not an image.

returns.summary: The image with an alpha channel in a blob, or null if this blob is not an image.

methods.name: imageWithRoundedCorner
methods.summary: Returns a copy of the underlying image with rounded corners added.
methods.description: Returns the new image as a blob, or null if this blob is not an image. The image will grow in height and width by (2 * borderSize) as the border is added around the image to avoid scaling. By default the borderSize is 1.

parameters.name: cornerSize
parameters.summary: Size of the rounded corners in pixels.

returns.summary: Image with a rounded corner in a blob, or null if this blob is not an image.

methods.name: imageWithTransparentBorder
methods.summary: Returns a copy of the underlying image with an added transparent border.
methods.description: Returns the new image as a blob, or null if this blob is not an image. The image will grow in height and width by (2 * borderSize) as the border is added around the image to avoid scaling.

parameters.name: size
parameters.summary: Width of the transparent border in pixels.

returns.summary: The image with a transparent border in a blob, or null if this blob is not an image.

methods.name: toString
methods.summary: Returns a string representation of this blob.

properties.name: file
properties.summary: File object represented by this blob, or null if this blob is not associated with a file.

properties.name: height
properties.summary: If this blob represents an image, this is the height of the image in pixels.
properties.description:
If this blob doesn't represent an image, height is reported as 0.

NOTE 1: On SDK versions prior to 9.1.0, Ti.Blob images may have reported in points, not pixels. This would occur for images with a higher density/scale returned by toImage or images with @dx density suffixes. You may multiply by logicalDensityFactor to try and determine the pixels, but this value may be off for some pixel/density combinations. (i.e. a 10px image would report as 3 on a 3x density screen, so multiplying would give you 9 pixels, which is still incorrect)

NOTE 2: This represents the height the platform decodes the image to in memory. iOS will automatically rotate a JPEG based on its EXIF orientation when loaded into memory, but Android does not and instead rotates it when shown on-screen. You can read the uprightHeight to determine what the image height will be after rotation, if applicable.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.summary: Mime type of the data in this blob.

properties.name: nativePath
properties.summary: If this blob represents a Titanium.Filesystem.File, this is the file URL that represents it.
properties.description: If this blob doesn't represent a file, the value of nativePath is null.

properties.name: size
properties.summary: Size of the blob in pixels (for image blobs) or bytes (for all other blobs).
properties.description: If this blob represents an image, this is the total number of pixels in the image. Otherwise it returns the number of bytes in the binary data.

properties.name: text
properties.summary: UTF-8 string representation of the data in this blob.
properties.description: If this blob represents pure binary data, the value will be null.

properties.name: uprightHeight
properties.summary: If the blob references an image, this provides the height in pixels after factoring in EXIF orientation.
properties.description:
The height of the image in pixels after rotating/flipping it based on its EXIF orientation, which is commonly the case with JPEGs. Will return the save value as the height property if image does not have an EXIF orientation or if the orientation is already upright.

On iOS, properties height and uprightHeight will always match. On Android, these properties may differ when loading a JPEG since this platform does not automatically rotate the loaded image in memory, but it is rotated when displaying it on-screen.

properties.name: uprightWidth
properties.summary: If the blob references an image, this provides the width in pixels after factoring in EXIF orientation.
properties.description:
The width of the image in pixels after rotating/flipping it based on its EXIF orientation, which is commonly the case with JPEGs. Will return the save value as the width property if image does not have an EXIF orientation or if the orientation is already upright.

On iOS, properties width and uprightWidth will always match. On Android, these properties may differ when loading a JPEG since this platform does not automatically rotate the loaded image in memory, but it is rotated when displaying it on-screen.

properties.name: width
properties.summary: If this blob represents an image, this is the width of the image in pixels.
properties.description:
If this blob doesn't represent an image, width is reported as 0.

NOTE 1: On SDK versions prior to 9.1.0, Ti.Blob images may have reported in points, not pixels. This would occur for images with a higher density/scale returned by toImage or images with @dx density suffixes. You may multiply by logicalDensityFactor to try and determine the pixels, but this value may be off for some pixel/density combinations. (i.e. a 10px image would report as 3 on a 3x density screen, so multiplying would give you 9 pixels, which is still incorrect)

NOTE 2: This represents the width the platform decodes the image to in memory. iOS will automatically rotate a JPEG based on its EXIF orientation when loaded into memory, but Android does not and instead rotates it when shown on-screen. You can read the uprightWidth to determine what the image width will be after rotation, if applicable.
